args: I'm indebted for everything\nyou've done for me, sir.
Then I suppose I know your answer.
Yes. I know I haven't been putting my best\ninto my training latelyâ€”or anything else,\nfor that matter.

I just haven't been able to get what
happened that day out of my head.
My dream used to be so clear to me,
and now it's hopelessly muddled.
Maybe this is what I deserve for\nhaving an impossible dream.
You won't have to worry about me again.\nI'm going back to my hometown church.
Then I wish you the best of luck\nin your endeavors as a priest.

(It's been a few weeks since I gave up on
being a knight. I donned my vestments,
gave sermons, and heard confession as
any other priest would.)
(I dislike the slow pace of rural priestly\nlife, but at least it's safe and peaceful.)
So peaceful, in fact, that it feels like a lie.\nWe don't even have fiends in this sad\nlittle backwater burg!
Did I really see all those dead and dying\npeople on the front? It feels more like a\ndreamâ€”or maybe a nightmare.
Why, so it is. I wonder what this\nlittle fellow is doing here?
Well, you've been sighing a whole bunch\nsince you came back, so I brought it over\nto try and cheer you up!
I heard the grown-ups saying it was 'cause\nyour dreams were smushed or something.\nAre you okay?
I suppose that describes it\nas well as anything.
Though can a dream really be smushed\nif it was impossible from the start?
Never mind, child. This is turning into\na depressing conversation indeed.\n...Hmm? I hear people talking.
Apparently there's been another incident in\nthe Zatras districtâ€”and more casualties.
Again? It seems tales from the central\ndiocese are filled with nothing but trouble\nthese days.

From what I've heard, no matter how many
Templars they recruit they're always short-
handed, and the Hillheim district's Paladyn
ends up being sent out to fight every day.

It's hard to imagine with how peaceful
things are here. May the goddess watch
over and protect them in these trying
times.
The Hillheim district is where\nTobias was assigned.
He's probably fighting on the front lines\nright now. Please be okay, Tobias...

Okay, that's enough morbid thoughts!
He's strong enough to take care of
himselfâ€”and it's not really my concern
anymore regardless.
Gosh, but I feel so very low.
I can't get this weight off my shoulders,\nand lying down just makes it worse.
My hometown is tranquil. Peaceful.\nSo why am I feeling this way?
I don't have to look on the dead anymore!\nI don't have the pain of being unable to\nhelp themâ€”so why do I still HURT?
There was nothing I could do no matter\nhow hard I tried, so why can't I stop\nthinking about it?!
Do you often wander into fiend nests\nby your lonesome, child? You'd be\ndead in moments if not for me.
M-my dog got lost. I had to save him.
Well, I suppose that can't be helped.
So you're not mad at me, mister?
No. A certain hardheaded pupil of mine\nwould likely deem it a pointless endeavor,\nbut I'm rather fond of your courage myself.
Listen here, child: Trying and being unable\nto do something is different from not trying\nin the first place. So don't give up.
I can't tell you if your dog is all right,\nbut it's not the sort of thing you should\nwrite off just because you're not sure.
If you have the desire to help someone,\nyou should go out there and try to do it.\nNothing good comes from surrender.
You can't lie to your heart, after all.
Doing so will only come back to cause\npain at a later date. Do you understand?
Was that a dream? ...No. A memory.
When I was younger, I didn't worry about\nwhether or not I'd ACTUALLY be able\nto save people.
My heart just told me I wanted to.\nThat I HAD to!

But now I've put a lie to those feelings.
I tell myself it's pointless if I might not
be able to save someone, and suppress
my true thoughts...
Trying and being unable to help\nand not trying at all are different...
Which is why I have to go!
Better check my sword... Good, no rust.\nOoof! Feels heavy, thoughâ€”probably\nbecause I've neglected my training.
I don't want to live with regret, so please\ngive me your strength once more...
Such heavy rain would be trouble even\nin the best of times, but for a place\nthat's suffered so much damage...
By the goddess, look at all the bodies...\nI don't see a single survivor.
It's not like I can make a difference all by\nmyself if I go there now...
Hah hah. It's strange. I can't stop shaking,\nbut I can't stop walking forward, either.
After all, my heart is crying out for me\nto find people and save them.
And I won't lie to my heart anymore!
